stories.text:
Hello HN!
For the past 15 years, I've been working as a Software Developer Engineer. I've focused mostly in back-end languages, and also a bit of front-end (though I'm not up-to-date with the latest Front-End trends). I have added a lot of value to the companies I've worked for, but I have the feeling I've never been compensated fairly.
1) My question for you guys is: how much should I charge per hour?
2) Is there a way to finding clients or companies that pay better wages?
Thanks!
stories.title: Ask HN: Yrs exp SDE, how much should I charge?

Rulex – A new, portable, regular expression language

stories.text:
I'm playing around doing leetcode challenges for fun where I stumbled upon one which required quicksort. It struck me then that I've completely forgotten how to implement it (which I once did a couple of years ago at uni), I had to go to wikipedia and write it from pseudo code. All in all it took me about 30 min to solve.

This got me thinking; is this even an issue? Is there value in knowing algorithms like quicksort and Djikstra's by heart, as opposed to being confident that you're able to implement them given information on how to do it?
stories.title: Ask HN: Know algorithms, or know how to implement them?
